[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The DigitalHome (DH) system defines requirements for controlling temperature, humidity, lighting, security, and appliances.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: DH enables home automation through web interfaces and wireless controllers, integrating sensors and devices.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: DH integrates with controllers, sensors, and smart devices via wireless communication.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: DH provides a web-based interface for device monitoring and control.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: DH supports thermostats, humidistats, contact sensors, and power switches.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: DH relies on HTTP-based communication and database-backed systems.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: DH ensures secure data transmission using TLS.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: DH operates efficiently on minimal hardware with low memory usage.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: DH supports 24/7 operation with failover mechanisms.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: DH is customizable for various home sizes and configurations.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: DH connects with cloud-based services for backups and firmware updates.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: DH enables control of environmental settings, security systems, and smart appliances.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: DH is designed for homeowners with basic web navigation skills.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: DH is limited to simulated environments for prototype testing.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: DH requires broadband Internet and compatible smart devices.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Smart Device: A network-connected device with remote control capabilities.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall interface with wireless thermostats, humidistats, and sensors.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall support cloud-based services for backups and updates.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall allow users to set temperature and humidity levels remotely.
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall manage appliance states, including power switches and lighting.
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall provide real-time notifications for security breaches (REQ-INTF-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an intuitive web interface with user assistance features.
[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-002: The system shall include configuration wizards for initial setup.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall update sensor data within 2 seconds of changes.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall support up to 50 connected devices without degradation.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store user preferences and device configurations securely.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The system shall log all user interactions for auditing (REQ-FUNC-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall adhere to open standards such as IEEE 802.11 for wireless communication.
[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-002: The system shall use modular architecture for scalability.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with ASHRAE standards for environmental controls.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall log critical actions for auditing and provide error notifications.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Unit, integration, and compliance testing ensure adherence to requirements.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User guides and FAQs for onboarding and troubleshooting.
[SEC] 5. References: ASHRAE standards, IEEE specifications, and project documentation.
